topic: ALTER TABLE deployment RENAME COLUMN entryDateTime TO entryStartDateTime; ALTER TABLE deployment ADD COLUMN entryEndDateTime REAL; ALTER TABLE deployment RENAME COLUMN orientation TO bearing; ALTER TABLE deployment DROP COLUMN address; ALTER TABLE deployment DROP COLUMN description; ALTER TABLE deployment ADD COLUMN sensor TEXT;

name: capture deployment info, send diff sql queries
query latest active deployments
template:
SELECT id, entryStartDateTime, lat, lon, bearing, sensorName, deviceName
FROM deployment
WHERE entryStartDateTime IN(
  SELECT MAX(entryStartDateTime)
  FROM deployment
  WHERE entryEndDateTime IS NULL
  GROUP BY sensorName, deviceName
)
ORDER BY sensorName, deviceName;

name: create table deployment
template:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS deployment (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, 
    entryStartDateTime REAL, 
    entryEndDateTime REAL, 
    lat REAL, 
    lon REAL, 
    bearing TEXT, 
    sensorName TEXT, 
    deviceName TEXT
    );

name: select latest 5 rows from deployment
template:
SELECT * 
FROM deployment 
ORDER BY entryStartDateTime DESC 
LIMIT 5;

name: select latest active deployments
template:
SELECT id, entryStartDateTime, sensorName, deviceName 
FROM deployment 
WHERE entryStartDateTime IN (   
    SELECT MAX(entryStartDateTime)   
    FROM deployment   
    WHERE entryEndDateTime IS NULL   
    GROUP BY sensorName, deviceName 
    ) 
ORDER BY sensorName, deviceName;

INSERT INTO events (id, camera, label, sub_label, top_score, frame_time, start_time, end_time, entered_zones, score, area, ratio, motionless_count, position_changes, attributes, direction_calc, speed_calc, provenance, deployment_id, radarName) 
VALUES ($id, $camera, $label, $sub_label, $top_score, $frame_time, $start_time, $end_time, json($entered_zones), $score, $area, $ratio, $motionless_count, $position_changes, json($attributes), $direction_calc, $speed_calc, $provenance, $deployment_id, radarName);

create table events
template:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS events (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    camera TEXT,
    label TEXT,
    sub_label TEXT,
    top_score REAL,
    frame_time REAL,
    start_time REAL,
    end_time REAL,
    entered_zones TEXT,
    score REAL,
    area REAL,
    ratio REAL,
    motionless_count REAL,
    position_changes REAL,
    attributes TEXT,
    direction_calc TEXT,
    speed_calc REAL,
    source TEXT,
    deployment_id TEXT DEFAULT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (deployment_id) REFERENCES deployment(id)
    );

name: select latest 5 rows from events
template:
SELECT * 
FROM events 
ORDER BY end_time DESC 
LIMIT 5;

name: create sqlite query, daily summary in zone_capture
func:
//frame_time is already in seconds

const query = `
SELECT
    date(frame_time, 'unixepoch') as day,
    label,
    camera,
    COUNT(*) as count
FROM
    events
WHERE
    frame_time > (unixepoch('now') - (86400 * 10))
    AND camera = '${env.get("VAR_RADAR_CAMERA")}'
    AND entered_zones LIKE '%zone_capture%'
GROUP BY
    label, date(frame_time, 'unixepoch'), camera
ORDER BY
    label, day, camera;
`;

msg.topic = query;
return msg;

name: structure daily summary payload
create sqlite query, 1-hour counts last day in zone_capture
func:
//frame_time is already in seconds

const query = `
SELECT
    strftime('%FT%H:00:00.000Z', frame_time, 'unixepoch') as hour,
    label,
    camera,
    COUNT(*) as count
FROM
    events
WHERE
    frame_time > (unixepoch('now') - (86400 * 1))
    AND camera = '${env.get("VAR_RADAR_CAMERA")}'
    AND entered_zones LIKE '%zone_capture%'
GROUP BY
    label, strftime('%F %H', frame_time, 'unixepoch'), camera
ORDER BY
    label, hour, camera;
`;

msg.topic = query;
return msg;

name: structure 1-hour counts last day
create sqlite query, 1-hour counts last day in zone_radar
func:
//frame_time is already in seconds
//frame_time as 5-minute intervals, rounded up

const query = `
SELECT
    strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:00', (frame_time + 299), 'unixepoch', '-' || ((frame_time + 299) % 300) || ' seconds', 'localtime') AS bin_time,
    label,
    camera,
    COUNT(*) as count
FROM
    events
WHERE
    frame_time > (unixepoch('now') - (3600))
    AND camera = '${env.get("VAR_RADAR_CAMERA")}'
    AND entered_zones LIKE '%zone_radar%'
GROUP BY
    label, strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:00', (frame_time + 299), 'unixepoch', '-' || ((frame_time + 299) % 300) || ' seconds', 'localtime'), camera
ORDER BY
    label, bin_time, camera;
`;

msg.topic = query;
return msg;

name: structure 1-hour counts last day
create sqlite query, daily cumulative counts in zone_capture
func:
//frame_time is already in seconds

const query = `
SELECT
    label,
    COUNT(*) as count
FROM
    events
WHERE
    frame_time >= unixepoch(strftime('%Y-%m-%dT04:00','now', 'localtime'),'utc')
    AND camera = '${env.get("VAR_RADAR_CAMERA")}'
    AND entered_zones LIKE '%zone_capture%'
GROUP BY 
    label
ORDER BY
    label;
`;

msg.topic = query;
return msg;

name: structure daily object counts for chart
structure daily object counts for tm/events
create sqlite query, daily cumulative CAR counts in zone_capture + zone_radar that HAVE valid speed_calc
func:
//frame_time is already in seconds
//cars with speeds in zone_radar AND zone_capture since 0400 today

const query = `
WITH results AS (
  SELECT 
    COUNT(*) AS count,
    AVG(ABS(speed_calc)) AS mean_speed,
    MAX(CASE WHEN ntile = 5 THEN ABS(speed_calc) ELSE NULL END) AS p25_speed,
    MAX(CASE WHEN ntile = 10 THEN ABS(speed_calc) ELSE NULL END) AS p50_speed,
    MAX(CASE WHEN ntile = 15 THEN ABS(speed_calc) ELSE NULL END) AS p75_speed,
    MAX(CASE WHEN ntile = 17 THEN ABS(speed_calc) ELSE NULL END) AS p85_speed,
    MAX(ABS(speed_calc)) AS max_speed,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ABS(speed_calc) > 25 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS count_over_25,
    JSON_GROUP_ARRAY(speed_calc) AS speeds
  FROM 
    (SELECT 
       ABS(speed_calc) as speed_calc,
       NTILE(20) OVER (ORDER BY ABS(speed_calc)) AS ntile
     FROM 
       events
     WHERE 
       frame_time >= unixepoch(strftime('%Y-%m-%dT04:00','now', 'localtime'),'utc') AND
       label = 'car' AND
       entered_zones LIKE '%zone_radar%' AND
       entered_zones LIKE '%zone_capture%' AND
       ABS(speed_calc) NOT NULL AND
       camera = '${env.get("VAR_RADAR_CAMERA")}'
    )
)
SELECT 
  *, 
  p75_speed + 1.5 * (p75_speed - p25_speed) AS iqr_upper,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM json_each(results.speeds) WHERE json_each.value > p75_speed + 1.5 * (p75_speed - p25_speed)) AS iqr_upper_freq
FROM 
  results;
`;

msg.topic = query;
return msg;

name: comments instructions
format:
Create Comments

Comments are date-sensitive entries about the Traffic Monitor status, deployment, location, conditions, construction, etc.
These comments do not directly impact any display or counts but may be used for downstream analysis. Do not include any personally identifiable information.

name: download DB instructions
format:
Download databases

The links below will download the entire Traffic Monitor device events and/or sensor SQLite database(s) to your current browser. Database will include events and/or sensor readings only from this device while the Traffic Monitor was deployed and running.

name: json button instructions
format:
Generate JSON payloads

You may also generate selectable DateTime-constrained JSON payloads from events and/or radar database tables using the respective below buttons.

backup and restore instructions
format:
Backup and Restore functionality allow you to save settings to ThingsBoard as client-side attributes for returning your traffic monitor to the saved configuration.

Backup and Restore works for the following configs:

  • Frigate config.yml

Only one (1) backup is valid at a time.

name: Hardware
OS and Hardware Metrics Documentation
info:
Send various operating system and hardware metrics to the ThingsBoard server as telemetry:
 - See [node-red-contrib-os](https://github.com/Argonne-National-Laboratory/node-red-contrib-os/blob/master/README.md) package for definition of operating system metrics
 - Most of the hardware metrics come from the [vcgencmd command line tool](https://elinux.org/RPI_vcgencmd_usage). Both that documenation and others that are available online seem to be out-of-date. See also [How to Benchmark a Raspberry Pi Using Vcgencmd](https://www.tomshardware.com/how-to/raspberry-pi-benchmark-vcgencmd).
 - hardware cpu_percent is obtained from [psutil](https://psutil.readthedocs.io/en/latest/).
 - hardware meminfo comes from 'cat /proc/meminfo'.

name: Errors that occurred while getting Hardware metrics
